dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: is being carried by a world weary middle European wearing armband. VLADIMIR NEKHORVICH exits a gleaming building, for a moment, under a motto clearly visible above his hea 'Where the future is now'. He checks the time.

dialogues.speaker: WATCH
dialogues.text: set in Countdown Mode. It's at 19 hours forty-sev sixteen seconds and dropping, 19:37.15, :14, :13, :12 O.S. children are singing: Ring a ring a rosy/a pocketful of posy/ a tissue a tissue/we all fall down. Nekhorvich looks to see children at play outside the adja Natural History Museum. They are moving in and around an freeform sculpture.

dialogues.speaker: SCULPTURE AND CHILDREN
dialogues.text: a blur where the sculpture seems to be distorting the chi almost like mirrors in a fun house.

dialogues.speaker: NEKHORVICH
dialogues.text: wipes his eyes, a horn honks.  He looks toward the sound.

dialogues.speaker: SATCHEL, (INT. AIRPORT SECURITY - DAY)
dialogues.text: on the belt that takes it thru X-Ray.  On the other side opens the satchel and pokes thru a few toilet articles, p items, books, a battleship gray digital camera and - in a plastic container marked 'S.G.' - a small, square shiny o hi-tech and at odds with the other items.  She pulls out shaped vessel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's this, then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (handing her documents)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ashes of a colleague, I'm taking them to his family.  If you wish to open it, please be careful.

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTERIZED SCREEN DISPLAY, (INT. PLANE - MOVING - DAY)
dialogues.text: on the cabin wall displays a colorful map showing the fli point of departure in Sydney, continuously updating dista direction and time to its ultimate destination, Atlanta,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - folks, we're a little over two and a  half hours from touchdown in Atlanta, but  if you look out your windows on either  side of the aircraft, we'll soon be  crossing the southern section of the Rocky  Mountains, a range which includes more  than 50 peaks rising above 14,000 feet.   The chain's loftiest point, Mount Elbert,  at 14, 433 feet should be coming into view  as we pass over central Colorado shortly..

dialogues.speaker: NEKHORVICH, (INT. CABIN - DAY)
dialogues.text: seems intent on the map, its changing times and distance. checks his watch - the countdown has gone from 20 to thre and 32 minutes as Nekhorvich is mesmerized by the descend seconds whipping by. ETHAN HUNT sits into shot on the vacant first class aisle beside Nekhorvich.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You keep staring at that watch as if your life depended on it, Doctor..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, yes.  I suppose I am a bit anxious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're ready and waiting.  You'll soon be  with old friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (meaning Ethan)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm with an old friend now, Dmitri.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry it couldn't be under happier  circumstances.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I'm sorry too.. 'You're sorry and I'm sorry..' (bemused laughter, then looks at Ethan)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - you do know Gradski thought the world of you. Nekhorvich is overcome.  Ethan puts a comforting hand on shoulder:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was quite a man.  Did he know before  the end you two had succeeded?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, he knew.  Just..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ..not in time to save him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. After you've lived with Chimera for twenty hours, nothing can save you. Not even...Bellerophon. Nekhorvich pats the satchel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You carry them together?  Safely? With an almost impish grin and a wink:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, and you'll get us to a safe place  with them, thank god!..left to my own  devices, I'm an old fart too inept to read  a railroad timetable!.. Good-natured laughter.  Cut off by a flight steward who p by, giving a sidelong silence in Ethan and Nekhorvich's d Oxygen masks suddenly deploy from the ceiling.  Passenger puzzled and alarmed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You Captain again.  We've experienced a  slight but abrupt drop in cabin pressure..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A passenger struggling with his mask.  As Nekhorvich fumb the strap on his mask he notes that the display screen sh their altitude is below 30,000 feet and dropping.  He che countdown time on his watch again.  Nekhorvich looks arou The flight attendants are conspicuously absent and all th passengers who have on oxygen masks are passed out.

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: The flight crew now wearing their oxygen masks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pan, pan, pan, Denver Center.  This is  Trans Pac Flight two-two-zero-seven, 747  heavy.  We are not reading you.  We're  unable to maintain cabin pressurization.   We have initiated a descent to one six thousand. The Co-pilot is working on the plane's altitude when his slip off the controls.  His eyes flutter, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain, I don't..can't.. He passes out.  The Captain, HUGH STAMP, turns to verify relief pilot is also unconscious at the controls. He then removes his oxygen mask, sets the auto pilot, inp numbers to slow the plane and descend.  As the craft titl downward...

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: The flight attendants are pulling on jump suits.  Stamp e from the cockpit.

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: Ethan returns.  Nekhorvich beckons to him.  Ethan sits. around, Nekhorvich conspiratorially:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ..it seems we have a problem, Dmitri.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in the same tone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You keep calling me Dmitri.  You really  shouldn't. Nekhorvich's eyes narrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not Dmitri? With a lightning swift move Ethan breaks Nekhorvich's nec

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - no. He grabs the satchel. ETHAN (cont'd) (to Wallis)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wallis, hold onto it. Wallis slashes the satchel handle open, takes the satchel Ambrose.  He peels off the latex mask, revealing SEAN AMB ETHAN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ulrich, pull the - He tears off the vocal oscillator at his adam's apple, cl throat, now as Ambrose:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - pull the NO2 tank and dump it, it's potential evidence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (the 'captain' into shot)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All done, chief..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (what else)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - right - (kidding)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - don't go too far ahead of me now -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not possible.. Ulrich has rolled back the carpet over an access panel ju beneath them that leads to the belly of the plane.  Stamp back the panel, hops into the compartment below which is walls of electronic equipment.  Stamp kneels and slides b floor hatch.  The wind howls, puffs of cloud zip by benea As they descend into the belly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Checkpoint Charlie plus 30, altitude minus  two-zero-thousand.  Airspeed one-seven- niner knots..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's that time.  Go. They don goggles and, with Ambrose in the lead,  the team leaps, one after another from the hatch, sailing into the sky.

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: An automated voice repeats in an ominous monotone:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terrain, terrain.  Pull up, pull up. The co-pilot stirs.  He blearily rouses himself just in t see: A mountain rushing toward him.  As mountain meets airplan frame is filled with fire, but when camera pulls back fro fireball, it is in fact no more than a match head filling which ignited, lights a fuse.. The MI theme music kicks in, the main credits roll to:

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: For a moment it might be thought part of the same range w plane crashed but when Ethan Hunt climbs into frame the a widen and titles down, revealing more of where he's come than where he's going.  Aside from the fact that he's in midst of free-climbing what is easily a sheer rock face o least a thousand feet, there's the sunny picture-postcard a lovely valley and pellucid lake thousands of feet below climbs out of shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: revealing the summit, a light breeze hitting the lichen a whatever growth has a slender purchase on the rocky mount fluffy clouds overhead. Ethan into shot.  Despite the spectacularly precarious ha he's using to hang onto the mountain and his life, he app relaxed, engaged - for him - in the equivalent of busman' holiday.  It's leisurely danger for Ethan; one might almo expect to hear Julie Andrews trilling 'Climb Every Mounta the soundtrack. Then a rock he's been grasping crumbles and Ethan drops a inches before he grabs onto the mountain again.  As he ha five fingers thousands of feet above the earth he doesn't terribly concerned until he spots a helicopter. It's materialized behind the summit and passes surprising just overhead, casting its shadow downward over Ethan.   Instinctively, Ethan flattens himself against the rock su as if the copter poses some sort of threat to him.  But w its rotors whir it into the distance Ethan relaxes and re climb.

dialogues.speaker: A HAIRY OVERHANG, (EXT. MOUNTAIN - DAY)
dialogues.text: near the summit Ethan departing from the vertical and is traversing the mountain with more of his back than his fe exposed to the earth far below.  He's clinging to the mou almost like a fly walking on the ceiling.  When he reache handhold that will restore him to the vertical, he dislod lizard - and manages to catch it before it plunges thousa feet to oblivion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoaa.. He pockets the lizard, climbs the overhang.

dialogues.speaker: SUMMIT
dialogues.text: with Ethan's hand, then Ethan coming into view and making summit.  He reaches into his pocket and releases the liza favors Ethan with a stern reptilian stare by way of grati lizard:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're welcome. The lizard scampers off, then a low beeping sound at his attracts his attention.  He turns to see the source of th beeping, a small package in day-glo colors with a day-glo streamer.  Ethan looks to the sky where the helicopter is ominously circling back. Ethan lifts the day-glo package and waves it in the direc the copter.  With a distinct lack of enthusiasm. The helicopter once again turns, banks and disappears.  E opened the beeping package and finds a pair of sunglasses

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First, a retinal scan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Identity confirmed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning, Mr. Hunt. Swanbeck's face flashes onscreen.  Over his introduction is a series of satellite photographs whose subject is so she never seems to give the camera a clean shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your mission, should you choose to accept it, requires you to recover a stolen item, designated Chimera. Essential to the mission is the recruitment of a civilian -- a Miss Nyah Nordoff-Hall. She is a highly capable professional thief currently active in Spain. A series of Nyah's 'accomplishments', i.e., warrants, com Interpol summaries of her various criminal activities, as glimpses of the elusive Nyah circulating about Seville. SWANBECK'S VOICE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her dossier's available on I-COM 3.  You  have 48 hours to recruit Ms. Nordoff-Hall  and meet me in Seville to receive further  details.  Should you or any member of your  IM force be caught or killed, the  Secretary will disavow all knowledge of  your actions. Swanbeck's face reappears on screen: SWANBECK'S VOICE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Mr. Hunt - the next time you go on  vacation, please be good enough to let us  know where you're going.  This message will  self-destruct in five seconds. Ethan removes the glasses, then tosses them into space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I let you know where I'm going - The glasses explode in a puff of smoke. ETHAN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - won't be on holiday. Ethan, with a fair amount of disgust, gets to his feet an off the mountain, in, what for a moment looks like a suic snit.  Then, somewhere hundreds of feet below camera, the little puff of color as the tulip-shaped chute pops out o back-pack.  Begin the sound of a castanets and the animal of flamenco dancers.

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: Bustling in the activity of a large private party, with a guests and attentive valets, as a young woman, her face u exits her car and enters the villa.

dialogues.speaker: A FLASH OF SKIRT AND LACE
dialogues.text: where to the cries of dancers add graceful feminine hands wielding the castanets.  The dancers perform on a raised and NYAH NORDOFF-HALL'S face can be glimpsed thru the swi skirts and pounding heels, looking thru, not at them.

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: looking back in a similar way to Nyah; surreal lighting a relentless chorus of pounding heels seem to isolate them crowed party.  Nyah continues to look at Ethan over the s over her wanna-be escort, a very attentive gentleman.  Ny offers up her empty glass, and the gentleman eagerly take the bar for a refill, leaving Nyah and Ethan looking at o another.  Ethan approaches her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Should I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  You just looked as if you did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Just as if I'd like to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.  Well.  I think that can be arranged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not tonight.  Bad timing.  Sorry -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's not enough time in the world for  any of it to be bad. This stops her.  Nyah moves closer to him, until they're to nose.  Whispered but breezy:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, it's either you or the rent and I  don't mind telling you it's not an easy  choice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if I pay the rent?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh? Glancing at the gentleman making his way back with her dr then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go find the wealthy lady you came with and  next time we meet - I'll pay your rent.  (kissing him, sweetly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now bugger off. And purposeful creature that she is, she takes her frustr desire upstairs, timing her footsteps so as to use the so the dancer's steps to cover her own.  Once upstairs, a se guard near the master bedroom can be seen eagerly followi down the hall, both moving past a pair of windows, visibl Ethan.  In a few moments, Nyah can be seen past the  windows in the opposite direction, without the guard foll In another moment or two, a very puzzled looking security can be glimpsed in the first window, looking up and down hall, clearly having lost sight of Nyah.  Ethan smiles, m of shot.

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: Nyah has opened the door and moves swiftly thru the bedro

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: A decadent looking affair with suggestive lighting, mirro walls.  The tub has a tray across it which includes a win chilling a bottle of Crystal and a mound of caviar on a b ice.  Nyah can't resist.  She spoons a dollop of the cavi downs it before she moves along the frescoed walls of the its back.  There, she pulls out her compact and removes t revealing an electronic density meter.  She turns it on a it at the rear of the tub.  Its sweep gauge jumps sharply green thru yellow and into red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (her fondest hopes confirmed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmmm. She now steps into the tub and focuses on the grout betwe tiles just above the sop dish.  Her knee eyes search for cracks in the grout and she spots one.  Using a tweezers pulls the silver of the grout out from between the tiles, something that looks like a credit card wedged between th She slips the card into a narrow opening under the sop di There's the sound of hydraulics and two arms move the mar casing out from the rear of the tub.  Nyah breathes a sig relief and anticipation: kneeling in the tub she finds he looking down at an open safe, revealing some half-dozen l compartments.  As she studies them:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Decisions, decisions. Nyah looks up to see Ethan's reflection in the bathroom  mirrors, looking down at her kneeling in the tub.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think you're the only one who can pick a  lock?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not altogether pleased)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see.  You're not just another pretty face.. Before Ethan can answer, a voice can be heard coming from bedroom warbling Granada in Spanish, and with considerabl NYAH (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh god.  A bloody baritone. Nyah catches a reflection behind Ethan's in the bathroom She reaches up and grabs Ethan by the lapel, yanking him tub, pulling him down on top of her.  Once again they're nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I take it you prefer tenors. She glances up at the mirror.  In it is the reflection of AUGUSTO DE L'ARENA, a big amiable Castilian in his fiftie changing a white dinner jacket that's had wine split on i breaks into a heavily accented version of 'Now or Never', disappears from the dressing room mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you mind if I'm on top?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, either way works for me. With a jaundiced look she rolls over on top of Ethan and working on one of the safe compartments, using a tiny tor wrench from a tube of lipstick and a carbide pick from a brush.  She glances down and is rather disconcerted.  Con working with the pick and wrench.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're never gonna find it there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (she jumps, dropping the torque wrench)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn it!  Find what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His ex-wife's Bulgari necklace that goes  up for auction Tuesday. Looking down to Ethan, a touch of indignation:

dialogues.speaker: LOOKING UP
dialogues.text: more or less, hands locked behind his neck as he rests ag the raked back of the tub, his eyes and nose inches from lower pelvic region as she straddles him.  Not exactly in to move: She stiffens - he knows too damn much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - right..where is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Far right.  She immediately switches her efforts from top left to the bottom right compartment.  She's utterly nonplussed:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the bloody -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (plucking it off his chest, offering it up like a mechanic under the chassis)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - torque wrench.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - this is very disconerting..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you put me here.  I just do what I'm told.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - right.. She unstraddles him and, with a few deft moves with the t wrench and carbide pick - and it's open.  She withdraws a pouch and opens the pouch.  Out spills the spectacular ne NYAH (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lovely. (starting to close the safe)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you and what's it going to cost me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (having sat up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do what? The alarm goes off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That. The bathroom is suddenly filled with security guards, gun Senor de l'Arena, looking highly upset, pops in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Senor Keyes, thank God it is you! (in Spanish to security guards, annoyed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Senor Keyes, the security engineer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Senor de l'Arena the goods news is that the heat sensors were activated.   But Miss Nordoff-Hall, my associate - Senor de l'Arena kisses Nyah's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mucho gusto, senorita.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - did feel that she had rather too long to work on the safe before they triggered the alarm, isn't that right Miss Hall?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yes.  Absolutely.  Much too long I should yes. Nyah's initial shock and panic slowly gives way to a wary intensified curiosity - about Ethan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Under the circumstances I think we would recommend re-setting the senors to respond to a lighter load.  How do you feel about forty kilos, Miss Hall?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indeed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Senor de l'Arena, there's no reason  to disrupt your party any longer.  we have some further concerns about the disposition of your security guards, which you'll receive in our written report by fax in the morning, hard copy to follow.  Shall we? He offers Nyah his arm.  They start out.  Ethan immediate ETHAN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Hall. Haven't you forgotten something? Nyah looking genuinely puzzled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The necklace? Nyah slowly reaches into her dress and withdraws the glit string of diamonds and rubies from her bust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a great kidder)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you trying to do, senorita?  Rob me. They all laugh, and Ethan's got her out the door.

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: The stars dimming, the sky a gun metal blue.  Ethan and N emerge from the villa, walking slowly.  Nyah's clearly preoccupied.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm missing something here, aside from a 500,000 pound necklace.  Even after I botched the job, I could've walked out of  there with the bloody thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At least you walked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you weren't going to let me get away with it, why did you let me go thru with it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wanted to see how good you were. I'm hoping we might work together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I say something, no offence?  You look like a gigolo, you sound like a  thief, you act like a cop - what the bloody hell do you have in mind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Working under adverse conditions.  Highly adverse conditions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds smashing.  I'm in.  Muchacho, mi carro, por favor!  Now be serious.  You couldn't possibly want me off tonight's performance..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't do that badly. Her car arrives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as she moves to her car)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're apologizing for me?  Quite the gentleman..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (opening the car door)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not really.  I triggered the alarm.. One foot on the floorboard she freezes, back to Ethan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, the Bulgari job last week was flawless.  And I've always been partial to pale yellows. She slides behind the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as he leads on the car)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't do laundry, or put up with cheeky bastards who set me up on their territory so they can poach on mine. She takes off, spewing bits of gravel and dust in her wak Ethan smiles and shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE ROAD
dialogues.text: around curves, hair flying, she's free.  Her car phone ri Perplexed, she lets it ring once or twice picks it up:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tentatively)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hola..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.  Would you mind slowing down?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did you get this number?  I don't even have it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like it? She hits the End button and disconnects.  The phone immed rings again.  She refuses to pick up.  Ethan pulls alongs She looks at him.  They speak through the open cars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pull over and listen to me, will you? Just listen..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need your help and I thin you can use mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your help?  What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scotland Yard, Interpol, every Dutch authority.  I can make them go away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh bloody hell.  You're a spy. She floors it and shoots ahead of Ethan, nicking his car

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I deserved that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ethan rings her again.  And keeps ringing.  Her face beco grim, her flight progressively more desperate and with Et pursuit progressively more determined.  They are reaching limits of adhesion around blind curves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sky's battleship gray; Ethan pursues Nyah around hair turns high above the Costa del Sol; they rip thru patches marine fog drifting on the road, obscuring it. Both are appalled by the other's willingness to escalate this game of flight and pursuit until Ethan tears thru a and sees on his GPS what Nyah can't see thru the fog -  less than four hundred meters ahead is a turn she can't p negotiate and if she can't she'll plunge off the road hun feet to rock and sea below.  Ringing her number again:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (half to himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slow down, slow down. She turns up a mound and loses control.  She spins out an toward the edge of the cliff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (realizing she's in trouble)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-oh. Ethan cuts her off and sends them both into a 540 degree Her car stops just at the cliff's edge. Furious she wrenches open the car door and gets out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! Suddenly there's no Nyah.  Ethan leaps over to Nyah's car sees Nyah dangling over the ocean and rocks hundreds of f below, holding the door handle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh..oh.. Taking a firm grip on her wrist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't look down.  Just..look at me. That's it..that's it.. He pulls Nyah up to the car, across the seat and half int his arms.  For a long moment it looks like she's in shock

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's you name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ethan Hunt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Ethan Hunt, what is it you want to talk to me about? Thru the veil of morning fog, Nyah looks at Ethan.  Her d suggest wit, and willingness, and longing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...more than I thought..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They scarcely to move to bring their lips together:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Awfully short notice..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Care to wait a decent interval?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who wants to be decent?..

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN, (INT-EXT. SAFEHOUSE - SEVILLE - DAY-EVE)
dialogues.text: sleeping.  His eyes open slowly.  He comes to full consci his head still on the pillow.  Something approaching seri anxiety informs his features.  He lifts his head and look left, angle widening.  Nyah lies on her side facing him, sleeping serenely.  Anxiety on the order of oh-God-this-i approved-recruiting-technique, confirmed.  He lets his he back on the pillow.  Then he turns so he and Nyah are pro profile.  As he looks at her sleeping his anxiety fades, by curiosity and even wonder.  He lifts his hand and just brushes her cheek.  Her eyes open.  She knows where she i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what've you got against spooks? Nyah smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When they've got your recruiting technique?  Not a thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.  Well..this isn't exactly by the book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've got a book for this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've got a book for everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only other spook I knew was a liar. Charming but absolutely incapable of telling the truth.  He'd lie about his favorite color.  But then I reckon it's an occupational hazard.  All spies really do is conceal the truth and tell lies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not revealing information doesn't necessarily make someone a liar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not the point.  In the end what spies rely on is the one thing they think they know that you don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That they're lying. Ethan laughs. NYAH (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ..once they know that they can get very very..crosee.. Nyah shoulder and moves into Ethan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So where did I got right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not a liar.  Or you're an awfully good one.. (then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ..this thing these blokes pinched..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know that they 'pinched' it. Don't even know that they're blokes. Nyah stops to think about this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, then, what I am I doing here?  I assume I'm meant to be some sort of thief-to catch-a-thief..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So do I.  Sort of. Nyah looks at Ethan, a little worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spoken like a spook..you ever afraid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of what? Nyah laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ask a question, you get an answer!..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn, you're beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's because I'm on my back. Quick as a cat Ethan flips Nyah over so she's looking dow at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so. She sinks into his arms.

dialogues.speaker: EXT-INT
dialogues.text: Ethan's step is unusually jaunty as he bounces along, mak way thru the festive and jostling crowds preparing for th portion of the Fallas de Valencia. On this night mache effigies, some serious, some comic, are placed all city and torched in great bonfires. Outside the bar Etha looking for there's a street vendor, hawking Fallas memen flowers. He starts past the vendor, and it hits him - he to buy some flowers. He chooses a colorful spring bouquet so fresh the dew can seen on the petals. Ethan pays the vendor, starts into t and thinks better of walking into Swanbeck with the bouqu Turns back to the vendor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you gonna be here a while?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Si, senor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll pick'em up on my way out, okay? Ethan enter the bar and goes upstairs to the second floor he passes security at a pair of double doors.

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: Swanbeck stands looking out the window.  Noisy crowds fro festival provides a constant walla, and during the sequen first effigies are lit, and smoke and flame provide a viv background thru briefing room's window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fetival's a pain in the ass.  Honoring saint by setting'em on fire. (turning to Ethan)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit down, sit down. Ethan sits. SWANBECK (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's you know what they think of saints, doesn't it?  Damn near set me on fire on my way over here.  As if I haven't been burned enough today. A moment where it's impossible to tell which way the wind going to blow between these two.  Then civilly: SWANBECK (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry I barged in on your vacation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry I didn't let you know where I was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be.  Wouldn't be on vacation if you did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well.  You're sorry and I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did you phrase it like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'You're sorry and I'm sorry.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta be kidding. Swanbeck turns to his computer and begins play on a DVD, projected onto a computer screen staring back at Ethan is

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with exaggerate brio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Dmitri!  How are you?.. Nekhorvich pauses as if waiting for reply.  Ethan smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ..I'm fine..and you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine.. Ethan laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine and you're fine.. With Ethan simultaneously whispering:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine too.. I'm fine and you're fine - do you remember, dear fried, how you got Sergei and I to repeat those lines from Dr. Strangelove and we gave you the name of that  silly Soviet Premier because we didn't know your name?..In those days, you not only saved our lives, you saved our sanity.  'Now, then Dmitri - we have this little problem': Every search for a hero must begin with something that every hero requires; a  villain.  Therefore, in a search for our hero, Bellerophon, we created a monster Chimera.  I beg you, Dmitri, come to Sydney and accompany me to Atlanta immediately. However we travel, I must arrive at me destination, within 20 hours of departure. Forgive this fanciful explanation, but for now prudence dictates that I communicate nothing but the gravest urgency. I fear I can entrust this to no one but you, Dmitri.  as we say, 'I'm sorry and you're sorry'.. Swanbeck stops the DVD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me ask you something.  You have any idea what the hell he's talking about? Ethan smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An idea, yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like it's a good idea to pick him up in a hurry.  And a bad idea to fly him on a commercial carrier.  So let's get on with it.  He's still in Sydney?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Vladimir Nekhorvich is dead.  So is his colleague, Gradski, but that happened earlier.  We had Nekhorvich on a flight from Sydney that crashed in the Rockies.. Ethan sits back, heavily. SWANBECK (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Hunt, are you listening?.. Slowly looking up:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If he didn't want to go anywhere without me, how did you get him on the flight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were there. Swanbeck clears his throat. He turns back to the compute punches in: MISSION DOUBLE IMAGE. File open to co of AMBROSE, SEAN, and HUNT, ETHAN, the computer scanning comparing their features, millimeter by millimeter, stat as the computer then imposes, with the help of the physio scan, Ethan's face on Ambrose: hence, mission double imag

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: slowly looks up at Swanbeck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I couldn't find you, I had to replace you.  Sean Ambrose was the obvious choice. He double you, what?  Two, three times?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you think of him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know we had reservations about each other.  Isn't it a little late in the day to be asking me that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not necessarily. Swanbeck shows Ethan a photo of airline Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Airline record list Captain Harold Macintosh as the pilot for Flt 2207.  as far as the media and all governmental agencies are concerned, Captain Macintosh died on the flight, but in fact he missed it.  He did, however make the next flight - in cargo, stuffed into a rather small  suitcase considering his size. Another photo of an open suitcase, the body in it partial obscured by a ring of police and customs officers. SWANBECK (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone on that flight planned an operation designed to down the plane and make it look like an accident.  Someone skillful enough to bring the whole thing off without a hitch but - they don't always get your luggage on the plane, even when you fly first class.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So there's one thing we know Ambrose doesn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you do think it was Ambrose. Ethan barely nods. SWANBECK (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you're not surprised. Ethan gives Swanbeck a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever Nekhorvich was carrying Sean wanted and he wanted to conceal the fact that he took it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enough to kill Nekhorvich and two hundred innocent passengers? Ethan smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean feels he hasn't done the job unless he leaves a lot of hats on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The question is why?  What was this Chimera Nekhorvich was carrying? Ethan rises and moves to the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right now only Ambrose knows that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In any case, you've got to recover Chimera and bring it to us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In order to do that, I've got to figure out how he plans to make money with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - right.  In fact since the plane went down our banking sources have confirmed a marked increase in the stock pilling of cash in terrorists accounts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Terrorists?'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well you know Nekhorvich's history. You're the one who got him out of the Soviet Union was it still in bio- weapon business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If that's what you're thinking Ambrose would have set up a bidding situation with any number of buyers before he got on the plane.  Locating him in time to stop something like that -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - is where Miss Hall comes in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (blindsided)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Hall and Ambrose had a relationship which he took very seriously.  She walked away and he's wanting her back ever since.  We believe she's our surest and  quickest way of location him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (acidly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then makes sure she continues to see him. Gets him confide in her and report to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You made it sound as if I was recruiting her for her skills as a thief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, then I mislead you.  Or you made the  wrong assumption.  Either way we're asking her to resume a prior relationship, not do  anything she hasn't already done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's got no training for this kind of thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go to bed with a man and lie to him? She's a woman.  She's got all the training she needs. Ethan's anger flashes but does his best to contain it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think I can get her to do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean it'll be difficult.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well it's not mission difficult, Hunt. It's mission impossible. Difficult should be a walk in the park for you. If you can think of a quicker way to get to Ambrose, you're welcome to try. Oh, by the way, you might want to take a look at these..if you have any further qualms about getting her to do the job. He pulls out a little Minolta digital camera (identical t one in Nekhorvich's bag at airport security). Swanbeck s the table. Ethan picks it up the tiny camera and puts it

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: A grim Ethan, starring fixedly ahead of him emerges to an more lively crowd.  as he does:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Senor, senor!  Your flowers. The vendor holds up the spring bouquet.  Ethan seems genu surprised by them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  They're very nice.. And he's lost in the crowd, leaving a very puzzled vendor the bouquet.

dialogues.speaker: STILL OF CRASH SITE IN ROCKIES
dialogues.text: One after the other flashing by.  They are more evocative specific in their suggestion of an abrupt, fiery, ending, the lives of hundred are literally and figuratively torn and strewn over a desolate landscape.

dialogues.speaker: NYAH
dialogues.text: carefully places the little Minolta on a glass-topped cof table.  She's beautifully pulled together, the safehouse lights low, flamenco music playing, and when she walks ou the balcony Ethan sees the candlelit table and a bottle o champagne chilling.  There's a light breeze the fire from burning effigies throwing smoke and flame all over the ci

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the population of Seville any idea?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five, six-hundred thousand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nearly 2 million in London.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And six billion in the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's lot of people out there..how many of them, I wonder, are capable of something like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean Ambrose, for one. A long shocked moment.  Nyah laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right...

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: The pounding beat of the flamenco music seems to fill the Nyah's back to Ethan:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grimly amused)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not that it matter much but..I seem to recall you staying something like, 'I was hoping we could work together.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This wasn't what I had in mind, Nyah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it is what you'd like me to do. so tell me to do it.. She approaches Ethan.  They're inches apart. NYAH (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, out with it.  Tell me to go and insinuate myself back into Sean's life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go and insinuate yourself back into Sean's life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like a little more conviction..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So would I.  But it's not mine to give.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (archness there)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've either got it or you don't.  Let your conscience be your guide?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something like that. With a smile and a wink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I don't have a conscience.  I'm a bloody thief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can be a thief and have a conscience.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  You can be a thief and have a conscience:  Not me.  Why did you have to tell me about this! (pouring herself a drink)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do I have to do to get away from this guy?  When you're with him, he messes about with your head every waking moment..even now I'll be at some out-of- the-way-place, a tin of caviar and a  bottle of Crystal shows up at the table, with two glass, God knows how he finds  out at any given moment where I am in the world but he does.  And it looks like he's done it again.  You know his definition of a  true paranoid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone in possession of all the facts. (she turns away, pauses)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you telling me I have to do this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Generally, I don't favor coercing someone. Not when there's a chance my life could end up in their hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that's the only reason?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you think of a better one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not me.  I was just hoping you might..or that..somehow in the course of business this got personal as well as physical.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, would it make you feel better if I didn't want you to do this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then feel better!.. Long moment while she looks at him. ETHAN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well.  That made all the difference in the  world, didn't it? Ethan walks out onto the balcony.  She looks at his back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean will never be anything but suspicious if he picks up some sort of 'yoo-hoo-I'm- not-nad' message.  Not after the way we broke up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What wouldn't make him suspicious?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Probably that I needed him in some urgent way..destitute - in serious trouble..the kind I couldn't possible sort out myself.. Ethan's been smiling slightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Serious trouble, Nyah, is something I can always arrange..

dialogues.speaker: NYAH IN A SPANISH JAIL
dialogues.text: standing for front and side mug shot.  O.S. sound of tele continues.  SUPERIMPOSE:  Ethan holding up something the a dime:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This little chip sends a coded signal that can be picked up only by our computer. On the screen of the GPS computer, a little yellow blip a pulsating on the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When it's in your ankle we can track you within three feet of anywhere in the  world.

dialogues.speaker: OVER ETHAN AND ONTO COMPUTER SCREEN
dialogues.text: He types a small Interpol bulletin stating that Nyah Nord Hall, apprehended March 13 in Seville, is awaiting extrad while the authorities in London, Paris, and Amsterdam squ over where she's going to be tried first, for the various and burglaries she's committed in the three cities.

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER SCREEN, (AMBROSE TENT ANNEX - DAY)
dialogues.text: Ambrose picking up on a version of the Interpol bulletin put out.  He leans over the screen for a moment, then mov the window, and stares out thoughtful at the bay, almost he were watching...

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: From a beautiful blue sky,  pan down to the courtyard of where Nyah is allowed out for an airing, seemingly alone being watched by:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His attention fixed on the screen, Ethan stares at satell shot of Nyah in the jail courtyard.

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: being allowed a phone call, a prison guard visible b.g. cut with Ethan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I can't run your arrest in CNN, but I guarantee he's monitoring every law  enforcement agency in the world, for what they might be saying about him, if nothing else - he's got the ability and, we assume, the desire to get you out of there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This doesn't seem to be accomplishing much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I mean it's not a total loss.  It is keeping a very capable thief off the street..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very funny..maybe he has heard and doesn't want to know.  Maybe he's lost interest. Her guard, b.g. is handed a note.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Nyah)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your lawyer to see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What lawyer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, here we go. SECTOR: AUSTRALIA, moving into NEW SOUTH WALES, and then Sydney. Here Ethan pulls up names, photos and profiles o potential candidates. They scroll past, one face morphin another. Ethan punches in on WILLIAM A. BAIRD. EXPERTIS Qualified in virtually every mode of transport, land, sea ORDINANCES: Small arms and automatic weapons authority, e impact weapons. PROCUREMENT: Resourceful. EXPLOSIVES: P detonation, diffusion. Ethan punches: Request immediate availability.

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: Nyah emerges from the entrance to the jail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop and look for something in you purse..kneel down.. She does.  They're effectively blocked from the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Limo's waiting. Ethan hands her a key chain with what appear to be a car-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Ambrose will have counter-surveillance second to no one's.  When and if he contacts you, push this button before you actually end up under his roof  it'll scramble your transmission to us. She takes the key chain.  Her hands are shaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When will you be there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can you possibly?  I've got to get right on the plane.  I'm leaving now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't trust me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I do.  But as we know I'm a very poor judge of character.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's got you on Qantas flight 2735.  It's going to be delayed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll be fine.  I'm going to lose you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ethan, you take care of yourself, I'll take care of myself because if push comes to shove, I'm gonna bail - and without giving two week notice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, forewarned is forearmed.  And while we're at it, be especially sensitive to any sudden change in Ambrose's plans, especially any involving you.. They rise.  A quick squeeze of her hand and he's gone.  A something like longing replaces the toughness as she gaze him, then starts across the street toward the limo and dr music theme kicks in and continues over:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: over the Harbor Bridge, sails dotting the bay like confet

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: pans of sheep are bleating and looking for sort of cover response to the sound of a helicopter touching down.

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: Billy and Luther emerge, Luther with computer looking acu uncomfortable in a wrinkled suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome to Australia, mate. They look up to a smiling Ethan who points to the ground Luther's feet.  Luther looks down to see that he is stand pile of sheep-shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks - mate. Both men laugh and all three move to:

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: Luther and Billy with Ethan setting up their operation. a blip on one of the screens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the transponder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put in the coordinates and let's get a  visual.  The visuals aren't coming up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The satellite doesn't work as fast as I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I've heard about you, Luther, and I just want to tell you it's an honor and a pleasure to be working with you blokes, whoaa!  That's some transponder! As Billy speaks, the visual come on line and Nyah has bec visible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a jaundiced eye, to Ethan)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It certainly is.  How did we get so lucky? Ethan pointedly ignore the question.

dialogues.speaker: MOVING, (PALM BEACH - DAY)
dialogues.text: rounding the tip of the bay's crescent, revealing the bea dock at Ambrose's palm-lined residence.

dialogues.speaker: NYAH
dialogues.text: The speedboat's engine's are cut.  Nyah looks momentarily stricken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: a lone slender figure silhouetted at the end of the dock, as the piling besides which it stands.  But the features obscured by the sun at his back.

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: leans forward as the slender figure grows larger,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Ethan)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it him, then?

dialogues.speaker: MOVING
dialogues.text: The tide is too low for the boat to dock, making it neces he boat to approach the shore.  The slender figure moves end of the dock and onto the beach.

dialogues.speaker: THE CIGARETTE
dialogues.text: idles into shadow water but the props start chewing into sand - the boatman grumbles he can't get any closer.  The figure has moved to the shoreline and the angle of the li changes - Ambrose is waiting. Nyah hesitates only a flicker of an instant, slips over t into thigh-high water without taking her eyes off Ambrose Ambrose strides right on into the bay.  as they are just length apart:

dialogues.speaker: NYAH
dialogues.text: takes a deep breath, presses the button to scramble the transponder.

dialogues.speaker: WITH ETHAN, (INT. SHEEPFARM SAFEHOUSE)
dialogues.text: The picture abruptly goes dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn.  Just when it was about to get interesting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay.  She scrambled the transmission.  Luther, continue feeding the GPS her position. Luther punches in.  The signal - and the global coordinat given.  They wait.

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: The satellite positions itself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't we speed this up. Luther shoots him a disgusted look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With what?  This is the only computer that'll do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have Bellerophon.

dialogues.text: (mildly)

dialogues.text: You took it!  All of it!  And what if I need it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (amused)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, please!  How was I to know they had to be treated with Bellerophon within twenty hours?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By asking me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You still don't get it, do you? You want to make an omelet, you break a few eggs - I needed to know just how bad the disease was - in the real world, not the lab. And you never know til you try. You thought you were genetically splicing together strains of influenza to create a cure for all influenzas. But I saw you creating a disease so terrible in Chimera that the cure would be priceless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanted the disease in order to peddle the cure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, the thought had occurred to me.  I needed Chimera in order to peddle Bellerophon.  For hero to be appreciated, you need a monster. Now that's not so difficult to understand, is it?  Look, time was a shot of penicillin could knock off every bloody bug in the zoo!  Not anymore!..have you any idea the R&D money it takes to float one little pissy boutique antibiotic that's barely effective against one strain of one bacterium?  If I couldn't makes  money killing the microscopic little shits that are out there, you'd help me put one out there I can make on!..there it is.  I've confessed.  I, John C. McCloy, am in business to make money.  Lilly's making billions feeding Prozac to depressed dogs.  Pfizer doesn't even know where to put the money they're making on Viagra, and let me tell you that shit didn't do a thing for me even at twice the recommended dose, Jesus, who do I have to screw to get a a break!..now get me out of here, get me treated and let's go back to work!..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I think it's a little late for that.  Do give my regards to Gradski if you see him.

Come on, now off you go! He gives her an affectionate smile and she reluctantly he to the house, her expression troubled, even suspicious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
