dialogues.text: 'Somewhere in Sydney?'  Care to harden the target?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't.  Until I can get the GPS up on our computer..it's still down..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clock is ticking.. Back to the matter at hand, Ethan completes the move on t guard and knocks him out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bellerophen?  No time at all once I've got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.  Biocyte stock is just a week or two away from going through the roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (alarmed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An outbreak of Chimera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In downtown Sydney for a start. McCloy is stunned. AMBROSE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You create the supply, Mr. McCloy, we've just created the demand.  Three million                 people in Sydney and 17 million people in Australia are going to need Bellerophen within a matter of days..not to mention the rest of the world..

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: stealthily approach a couple dozen jittery pigeons, cooin and pecking.  The intensity of their noise-making increas as Ethan reaches them.

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: Hearing the disruption of the pigeons, one of Ambrose's guards leaves his post at the double doors and head the  tunnel toward the birds to investigate.

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: Ambrose's guard draws his gun and continues approaching t pigeons.  Before the guard can see him, Ethan runs forwar sends the pigeons into scattered flight, blinding the gua Ethan jumps into a back flip and double kicks -- first kn away the guard's gun and then knocking him out and flat o back.  Ethan continues his flip and lands right back on h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- now here's the way it's going to work..Wallis, the shares outstanding are..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ninety-three point four million.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which means, Mr. McCloy, we have to get our hands on four hundred and eighty thousand options.  We'll borrow your thirty million to buy those options.  Your stock's never sold above thirty-one dollars a share.  We'll agree to buy at fifty.    AMBROSE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When your stock goes north of two hundred,  and it will, those options will be worth  billions.  We can borrow whatever we need  to buy the 48,000,000 shares, fifty-one  percent of Biocyte.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outrageous.  I won't let you take control of my company.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit down.  You'll be a billionaire.  Better than being broke.  I've got terrorists and other pharmaceutical companies standing in line.  Ball's in your court, Mr. McCloy.

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: Ethan pulls a can of explosive material form his pack.  H rolls it towards the double doors, and it stops just befo reaching them.  Then, pointing his gun to the ceiling, he fires into the air.

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: hears a noise and looks to Stamp, who heard it as well. Stamp nods to two guards to check it out.  They head acro the room to the double doors.

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: waits for the right moment before raising his and firing at the can of explosives.  Just as it ignites, the guards open the doors and are blown back by force of the explosi

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: reacts and turns toward the explosion.  Amidst the flames debris, a single white dove comes flying into the room. beyond it, Ambrose can see Ethan Hunt in silhouette walki slowly past the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Run that bastard down. Orders are shouted, and guards, along with Stamp, hotfoot the tunnel-corridor in the direction of the explosion.

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: run down the tunnel.  The guards move commando-style, dir by Stamp's hand signals.

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: Ambrose loads his gun and drags the tip of the barrel alo table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're running short on time, Mr. McCloy. We've got to conclude our business. McCloy pauses only a moment before nodding to his account

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, start the transfer. The accountant begins working on his laptop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Wallis)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Follow it.  Let me know.

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: pass a couple of doorways.  A pigeon flies past Stamp's f he stops.  As he turn, Ethan Lowers himself from a hiding in the ceiling.  Stamp and Ethan pull their guns on one a They're in a face-off until they both agree to drop their but Stamp catches his in mid-air and points it back at Et

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You broke our deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're too trusting.  Raise your hands slowly. As Ethan raises his hands, he pulls the pin on a grenade kicks it between Stamp's legs.  The handle flies off:  It When Stamp looks down in surprise at the grenade, Ethan k his gun. Trying to escape the grenade, Stamp smashes into Ethan an to have hit him in the jaw.  Both hit the ground as the g explodes, with Stamp appearing to have the upper hand.

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: As everyone waits for the transfer to complete, the grena explodes out in the tunnel.  McCloy and his accountant fr with alarm as a sprinkling of dust settles on the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the accountant)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep it going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean, this rat's reached the end of the maze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into walkie-talkie)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he alive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More or less.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring him to me.

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: Luther has the GPS computer starting to access the satell

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nervously)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're due to take off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not for seven more minutes.

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: checking his computer screen, which shows the transfer ha finished successfully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean.  Transfer complete. Stamp drags Ethan in, arms pinned with heavy tape.  Stamp Ethan look grimy as sandbags after a busy day of tunnelin Ambrose rises to examine his prize.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (apprehensive)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What exactly do you intend to do with him? Ambrose walks behind Ethan and kicks his knees out from u him.  Ethan falls to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ethan?  Ethan?  Do you copy? Luther hears nothing in response but while noise.  He loo Billy and indicates there's no answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, mate, maybe this is one of those times we shouldn't follow orders.

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: the rotor blades turn over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Ethan)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What have you got to say for yourself. Hunt?  Any last words? Ethan appears as if he wants to respond, but can't.  Ambr kicks him again. AMBROSE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop mumbling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Afraid he's got no choice.  I believe I broke his jaw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hugh, I'm impressed.. Ambrose has picked up a pair of Berettas, and is proceedi load both full seventeen round clips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (anxiety mounting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you intend to do? Ambrose favors McCloy with a glance of genial exacerbatio

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You needn't watch.

dialogues.speaker: HELICOPTER, (DAY)
dialogues.text: rising off the golf green, and banking toward the island.

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: Ambrose standing before Hunt with a pair of fully loaded Berettas.  The sound of the helicopter grows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - right.  We don't have a lot of time, Hunt.  whatever you've got to say, say it now. Ethan indeed makes some considerable effort to speak but manage a few guttural, progressively desperate sounds whi continue as:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AMBROSE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry mate, I can't understand a bloody word.  How about giving us a big smile to remember you by? (hearing the helicopter)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No?  Well, then.  This is what's known as getting your gun off. With that Ambrose empties thirty four rounds from the two Berettas into Ethan whose body jerks crazily on the floor McCloy nearly faints, and Ambrose laughs at his squeamish until something on Ethan's body catches his eye: the top little finger on the right hand is bleeding.  Ambrose gra Ethan's face, and rips off a latex mask: revealing Stamp, wide open and thoroughly lifeless.  His jaw, under the ma been taped carefully close with the same heavy tape Ethan used to mount the drain-pipe shotgun on the tunnel wall. AMBROSE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bloody hell! He looks around, but Stamp is gone.  So is the cannister kevlar vest that had been on the table moments before.

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: Ethan's on the motorcycle, heading toward the gates, whic of security guards are frantically trying to close. Billy and Luther in the copter are over the island, and b Luther can fire a grenade launcher and blow the back of A boat. The guards close the gate, Ethan runs the motorcycle up t hillock and jumps the gate, over onto the bridge.  Ambros in the SUV, crashing thru the gate. They race across the bridge and the road, onto the huge greensward opposite to and similar in shape to Bare Islan There, with the helicopter hovering, Ambrose manages to c Ethan and after they expend whatever ammunition their wea hold, they move into each other bare handed and engage in ferocious, no-holds-barred combat, the helicopter hoverin enough to keep away whatever's left of Ambrose's henchmen chopper's downdraft hitting them and flattening the grass them.  Ethan prevails.

dialogues.speaker: A SPECTACULAR VIEW OF SYDNEY
dialogues.text: on bluffs overlooking the city.  Camera moves slowly to t of the bluff.

dialogues.speaker: EXT/INT
dialogues.text: With Billy flying and Luther at the door, machine gun in hand, the copter nears the Bare Island gun pit and Ethan.

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: runs into the central 'hole' area, guns in both hands and wearing the kevlar vest.  He runs toward the walled edge the enclosure and jumps.  As he pulls himself up the top the wall, he sees the IMF helicopter approaching. A gunman appears from the tunnel entrance and opens fire, bullets exploding into the wall around Ethan, who jumps o of the way to avoid them.

dialogues.speaker: EXT/INT
dialogues.text: is under fire as well, bullets spraying the windshield, driving Luther back inside and causing Billy to turn the chopper around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man at your six.

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: who rolls and returns fire at the gunman.  Ethan first hi the gunman in the leg, and then shoots and explodes the canisters behind the gunman, killing him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Billy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The field of fire is too heavy.  Back off and pinpoint their positions.

dialogues.speaker: BEAR ISLAND HILL
dialogues.text: bearing down on him as he stands up.  Ethan just manages dive out of its path before a second motorcycle comes up the hill.  Ethan flips backwards and fires his pistol, shooting the second cyclist off his bike. The motorcycle flies over Ethan, who runs after it and ju on, revving the throttle and taking off.

dialogues.speaker: BEAR ISLAND
dialogues.text: deploys some of his men via walkie-talkie while others scramble into their cars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into walkie-talkie)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hunt's heading for the bridge.  Coming in at twelve o'clock high.

dialogues.speaker: BEAR ISLAND BRIDGE
dialogues.text: A Gold Falcon with several of Ambrose's men inside enters bridge from the mainland and speeds toward the island.

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: Ambrose's men exit the complex and get into their cars.

dialogues.speaker: BEAR ISLAND HILL
dialogues.text: crests a hill aboard the cycle, the IMF chopper in b.g.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clear that bridge for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're tracking you on the left, Ethan. Prepare for some fire.

dialogues.speaker: BEAR ISLAND ROADWAY
dialogues.text: Michael's SUV and Wallis' sedan speed along as a gunman f SUV fires on Ethan up the hill, spraying bullets around h

dialogues.speaker: BEAR ISLAND BRIDGE
dialogues.text: approaches the island.  Luther fires his grenade launcher hits the Falcon's trunk, lifting its back wheel off the g but the Falcon keeps coming, its trunk ablaze.  Luther re a gunman leans out the window, firing up at Ethan on the

dialogues.speaker: BEAR ISLAND HILL
dialogues.text: lays on the cycle's throttle, accelerates down the hill a propels the bike into the air and off the island, just as

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: again fires his grenade launcher, this time at the front

dialogues.speaker: BEAR ISLAND BRIDGE
dialogues.text: on the bridge.  The grenade explodes at the front of the and hurls the Falcon into the air and off the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: BEAR ISLAND
dialogues.text: is in mid-air on the cycle, heading down toward the bridg as he lands, the Gold Falcon flies off the bridge, and Et speeds through the flames and off onto the mainland.

dialogues.speaker: BEAR ISLAND
dialogues.text: Michael's SUV arrives and tears through the gate and flam followed by Wallis' sedan and then Ambrose, riding a moto

dialogues.speaker: ROAD LEADING FROM BRIDGE
dialogues.text: races up the road to find a white Falcon approaching. The IMF chopper arrives and gunfire's exchanged.  Luther hit in the shoulder and drops his gun as the chopper bank

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: Luther grips his shoulder in pain and falls back into his jarring the GPS computer.  It responds by beeping and com life.  Nyah's yellow dot pops up on the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The target is located.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ethan, the computer's up.  I've got Nyah. She's moved out of the city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luther, say again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's on the North Head Bluff -  approaching the cliffs.  One klick away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over increasing static)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Copy.  She's only got twenty-eight minutes left.  Track ahead and pick her up.

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: Luther bands his shoulder wound and monitors his GPS lapt

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We won't be able to cover you.

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: slightly slows the bike to concentrate over the static.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're breaking up.  Track ahead and pick her  up.  You've got me on GPS.  Bring her to me. Ethan pulls out and throws away the earpiece.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy, North Head.  Haul ass.

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: Ethan heads downhill as the SUV approaches on an adjacent He pulls out in front of it, immediately drawing fire.  W slowing, Ethan drops to the side his cycle for cover.

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: watches the GPS laptop as the chopper speeds over Sydney.

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: Wallis' sedan appears from an adjoining road and pulls in Ethan, who climbs back aboard his cycle.  Cut off, the SU onto a side road to intercept Ethan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't get a good shot. Before an intersection, Ethan both revs and brakes, spinn bike and creating a smoke screen.  Wallis' car enters the ULRICH (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't see him, mate.  Slow down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up.  I know what I'm doing. Wallis breaks hard, but not hard enough:  he stops just i path of an oncoming 18-wheeler.  His car's demolished.

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: Ethan pulls out of the smoke as the SUV bursts out of the behind him, striking the rear of the cycle.  Ethan puts h into a spin and pulls his gun, ending up alongside the SU passenger window.  He fires through the window, shooting Michael and the bodyguard. The SUV veers off, crashing into a line of parked cars. the first car and flips up and over, landing upside down several more parked cars.  Ethan speeds off on his smokin Ambrose arrives and then takes a side road.

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: working on his GPS laptop.  The range -- ie, the distance the moving copter to the yellow dot, Nyah, on the edge of screen -- is reduced to about two kilometers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Billy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Range is two kay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope there's a place to land. Luther looks up from the screen to see the bluff of North the entrance to Sydney's harbor.

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: tearing down the road, when suddenly from a side trail Am pulls out behind him and begins firing.  Ethan weaves to Ambrose's fire and passes a car, pulling in front of it f cover.  The car skids, forcing Ambrose to veer around it.

dialogues.speaker: FROM COPTER TO GROUND, (MOVING)
dialogues.text: rapidly approaching the North Head bluff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There she is.  I got visual.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're down to seven minutes 23 seconds..

dialogues.speaker: NORTH HEAD
dialogues.text: moving up behind Nyah who is walking purposefully to the the bluff and a precipitous drop to rocks and surf a hund fifty feet below. Camera drops to Nyah's shoulder level and moves with her bluff's edge.  As she's just a few steps away from steppi off, there's a roar and the helicopter rises into the sho before her wild-eyed Billy gesturing, 'Stop!  Stop!' to N

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: Ethan passes narrowly between a car and oncoming truck. follows as soon as the truck clears.  Ethan fires backwar his side-view mirror to aim, exploding Ambrose's windscre Ambrose skids until his wheel clips a rock, knocking him Ethan turns into a side road and speeds through open scru on the main road, Ambrose roars off to intercept Ethan.

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: On a clifftop clearing, Ethan races along as Ambrose move him off.  They head toward one another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ethan, we've got her.  Tracking to you now. We're reading 5 minutes 19 seconds.

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: Ethan and Ambrose round a bend and face one another.  Wit hesitating, they charge towards each other.  As they near another, each leaps forward and off his bike, and they co hard in mid-air.  They fall to the ground fighting as the skid and Ethan's explodes, raining debris upon them. Ethan and Ambrose rush towards one another.  Ethan flips to the ground.  Ambrose pulls a gun from his ankle holste Ethan knocks it away, he loses his own gun and they both a 30-foot cliff.

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: at top speed over Sydney.  Nyah appears weak and shivers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Billy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bearing two one zero.  About 3 klicks. (into microphone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ethan, we're moments away..

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: Ethan and Ambrose rise from the fall.  Ethan jumps up and Ambrose, dropping him to the ground.  Ethan begins strang Ambrose but gets knocked off, and when they both stand, A gets Ethan in a choke hold. Ambrose hits him and grabs a rock and hits Ethan in the midsection and the face.  Ethan kicks it out of his hand connects with several punches, knocking Ambrose to the gr Kneeling, Ambrose pulls a knife from a boot holster and c Ethan across the back and face.  Ambrose dives on Ethan a knife is poised above Ethan's eye before Ethan grabs the and clears, holding it out toward Ambrose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead.  Use it Hunt.  It's not a bad way to go.  A lot better than the way that bitch is going to die. Ambrose swings again and misses, and Ethan delivers a ser kicks, leaving Ambrose stunned and barely standing.  Etha back, and with a running start, strikes Ambrose with a le kick that drops him to the ground and knock the knife out hand.

dialogues.speaker: EXT/INT
dialogues.text: As they approach in the distance, Billy, Luther and Nyah gain sight of Ethan in hand-to-hand combat.

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: Ethan turns and walks away from Ambrose toward the cliff The copter lands and Luther runs toward Ethan but pulls u looking over Ethan's shoulder.  Ambrose has a gun aimed a Ethan's back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hunt.  You should have killed me. Near Hunt's feet is his own gun, obscured from Ambrose's dust from the copter.  Ethan tosses the canister to Luthe then kicks his gun up out of the dirt and into the air. catches it, drops down and fires, killing Ambrose.

dialogues.speaker: EXT/ INT
dialogues.text: Ethan reaches Nyah at the copter.  Inches apart, they can stare silently at one another.

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: Didgeridoo music.  A child admires a painting.  Swanbeck face one another.  A long, long pause.  For a moment it a if Swanbeck has lost awareness of Ethan's presence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, Ethan.  I don't quite know where to begin.  Any suggestions?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd like me to conduct my own debriefing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?  You've done just about everything else on this operation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd thank you -- but I'm not sure that was a compliment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course it was.  Anyone whose operations requires the level of disinformation that yours do, is bound to get a little flak here and there.  You try flogging the stories on CNN I've had to come up with about what's been going on around here the last few days.  At any rate, it's been most instructive -- what they'll swallow, or what they'll broadcast with a straight face. (picking up a file)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Hall's blood, it appears, has absolutely no elements of the Chimera virus.  Not even antibodies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I gathered as much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the only other remaining sample was in the canister you recover from Ambrose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that appears to have been destroyed. It also contained the anti-virus, Bellerophon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Bellerophon, it turns out, was only really effective against Chimera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you were under specific instructions to bring back a living sample of the Chimera virus.  I'd be very interested to know how, after you'd managed its recovery intact, it subsequently got destroyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By fire.  That's the best way, really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you didn't fail mission, you simply changed it. Ethan doesn't respond. SWANBECK (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's no longer enough for you to execute and implement IMF policy, you now wish to go in the business of creating it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I don't.  But in this case -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In this case, it wasn't a bad idea.  In face, it was a pretty damn good idea. Just don't make a habit of it.  And, as for Ms. Hall, in light of her efforts, her criminal records will certainly be expunged.  I'm assuming you approve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is she now, by the way?  Do you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't.  No exactly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Hunt, what are your plans?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not sure.  Some sort of vacation.  I'll let you know where I'm going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you don't have to do that. Wouldn't  be a vacation if you did. Ethan and Swanbeck exchange one final, knowing glance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This incident in the wake of rumors suddenly surfacing about Mr. McCloy and  Biocyte's financial difficulties -- including criminal allegations of insider  trading, embezzlement, conspiracy to commit fraud, and stock parking -- have, understandably, sent stock prices of the pharmaceutical company plummeting.

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: Ethan emerges to a very crowded street.  Billy and Luther waiting.  Both look to Ethan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (worried)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what did he say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good job.  And thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (incredulous)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it?  That's it? That's it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dryly, looking at Billy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the check's in the mall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.  Just remember, mates.  Billy Baird's the name.  Anything you need to get, move or watch, I'm your man. And Billy's gone.  Ethan and Luther remain alone, both re to say anything, both reluctant to leave. One quick bear hug, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Always nice hearing from you man.  Stay in  touch.. And Luther's off.  Ethan looks after him, a bit wistfully curiously tentative he moves off into the crowd.  After a dozen steps, something catches his eyes.  He stops. One quick bear hug, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a tad wary)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know me?

dialogues.speaker: NYAH
dialogues.text: is inches from him.  Without batting an eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Should I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  You just looked as if you did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... She wraps her arms around him and kisses him with conside conviction. ETHAN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...just as if I'd like to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.  Well.. He kisses her with a conviction that is more than a match hers. NYAH (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ..I think that can be arranged. Looks around at the swirling crowd:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get lost. And in a moment they've vanished from the frame and into crowd.  Camera begins to pull back, the bustling crowd ev filling the frame - and in the distance, perhaps, just a of a bouquet of flowers can be seen, appearing to bounce its own, the rising beat of the MI theme:
